title: Is a graduate certificate the same as a master's degree? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, it is not. I hold both, and the Master’s is much, much more intensive. A certificate is typically a lot fewer courses. With that said, both can be incredibly useful. To be honest, most people care less what I studied in grad school and are impressed that I have the degree; the certificate (which I hold in Evaluation) buys me some extra credibility in that topic. I’d encourage you to think about what you’re looking for. What are your educational goals? Why? Some employers are more inclined to hire/promote someone with a grad certificate; but it is a lighter program than a full Master’s. Also, don’t anticipate that the certificate courses will be any easier than their Master’s equivalents; mine were, on average, much harder! I’d encourage you to check out my free guide: 11 Mistakes Students Make Applying to Grad School. I think it will provide you some perspective, at least on the Master’s degree. For more information about what you should start thinking about, here’s a link to my service page (I coach students through the graduate application process at all levels, including certifications). Here’s the link: Services Best of luck!
No. A certificate means you took and passed some courses that are similar to the MA. The MA is usually much more comprehensive and takes longer to complete. It’s also a bit more expensive.
